CSPViolationReportBodyColumnNumber.summary: The columnNumber read-only property of the interface indicates the column number in the source file that triggered the Content Security Policy (CSP) violation.

remarks.para:
Note that the browser extracts the value from the global object of the file that triggered the violation.
If the resource that triggers the CSP violation is not loaded, the value will be null.
See for more information.
This property is most useful alongside and , as it provides the location of the column in that file and line that resulted in a violation.

CSPViolationReportBodyColumnNumber.value: An integer containing the column number that triggered the violation, or null.
